description: From Middle English contreve (“to invent”), from Old French controver (Modern French controuver), from trover (“to find”) (French trouver).

verbs.description: contrive (third-person singular simple present contrives, present participle contriving, simple past and past participle contrived)

entries.meaning: To invent by an exercise of ingenuity; to devise
To invent, to make devices; to form designs especially by improvisation.
To project, cast, or set forth, as in a projection of light.
(obsolete, transitive) To spend (time, or a period).
